## BIC selection of spline quantity

@tbl-bic displays the rejection frequencies for the optimal number of splines. The optimal number of splines was selected as the number of splines for which the OLS residuals produced the lowest Hansen's BIC [@eq-hansen-bic].


```{r}
#| label: tbl-bic
#| tbl-cap: Rejection frequencies for different variance estimators. Spatial data. Selecting the number of splines using Hansen's BIC.
#| echo: false
#| warning: false
#| eval: true
#| include: true

kernel_results <- read.csv("../Simulations/Products/bic_spline_sims_res_dd_2x.csv")

e_ar1_tbl <- read.csv("../Simulations/Products/bic_spline_sims_ar1_dd_2x.csv")


row_names_kernel<- c(
    "HR",
    "SCPC",
    "C-SCPC",
    rep(
        c(
            "Kernel 0.015",
            "Kernel 0.030",
            "Kernel 0.080"#,
            # "Damian's"
        ),
        1
    ),
        rep(
        c(
            "HR",
            "Kernel 0.015",
            "Kernel 0.030",
            "Kernel 0.080",
            "Damian's "

        ),
        2
    )
)

aux <- c(
    rep(
        "",
        4+2
    ),
    rep(
        c(
            "Order 1",
            "Order 2"
        ),
        each = 5
    )
)

table_kernel <- cbind(
    aux,
    row_names_kernel, 
    kernel_results#, 
)
names(table_kernel)<- c(
    "Splines",
    "Estimator",
    "Cons.",
    "$\\beta_1$"#,
)

aux2 <- c(
    rep(
        "",
        1
    ),
    rep(
        c(
            "Order 1",
            "Order 2"
        ),
        1
    )
)

table_ar1 <-cbind(
    aux2,
    e_ar1_tbl
)
names(table_ar1)<-c(
    "Splines",
    "Cons2",
    "$\\gamma_1$",
    "Hansen's",
    "Damian's",
    "Dropped"
)
table<-merge(table_kernel,table_ar1, by="Splines",sort=FALSE)

kbl(
    table[,-5], #- id, 
    digits=3, 
    booktabs = TRUE,
    longtable = TRUE,
    # col.names = col_names,
    # row.names = row_names,
    escape = F
    ) %>%
    add_header_above(
        c(" "=1,"Spatial data"=3," "=1,"BIC"=2)
    ) %>%
    add_header_above(
        c(" "=4,"Residuals"=4)
    ) %>%
    collapse_rows(
        c(1,5:8),
        latex_hline = "custom",
        custom_latex_hline = 1,
        valign = "top"#,
        # row_group_label_position = "stack"
    ) 



```



::: {#fig-bic-nsplines layout-ncol=2}

![Order 1]("../Simulations/Products/hist_n_splines_o1_bic_dd_2x.png"){#fig-bic-o1}

![Order 2]("../Simulations/Products/hist_n_splines_o2_bic_dd_2x.png"){#fig-bic-o2}

Distribution of the number of splines selected by the lowest BIC.
:::
